workout_file.description: Intermittent: This training is a way to introduce short high intensity riding alternating it with short recovery, allowing the rider to recover and accumulate time at an intensity that would be difficult to maintain if ridden consecutively.
workout_file.name: Week 4.2 - Intermittent

textevent.message: We have a fun one in store for today! Let's get started with a progressive warmup and start getting ready.
Do you have your towel, bottle, and fan all set? Perfect!
That's halfway through today's warmup, let's chat about what's in store for today.
We have a couple different 'flavors' of interval today, 1 is steady state, and 1 is more intermittent.
We'll start with our steady state work which will be 3, 5min intervals at 88% FTP, with 2mins recovery between.
Then, we'll move onto the intermittent work which consists of 6 reps, of 30sec right at FTP, plus 30sec at 73% FTP.
This training is a way to introduce short high intensity riding alternating it with short recovery.
Allowing you to recover and accumulate time at an intensity that would be difficult to maintain if ridden consecutively.
Sound like a plan? I think so too :-).
1min to go for our warmup, then we'll move right into the first 5min at 88% FTP interval.
For this first interval, let's aim for 85-95 RPM, nice and comfortable.
Here we go. Bring the power and cadence up just a little bit more and settle down.
We're here for 5mins.
1min into it. Find that rhythm here, and settle into it.
Relax the shoulders, bend the elbows slightly, relax your grip on the bars.
30sec to go! Nice job with this first effort!
Perfect! Now we'll take a couple of minutes easy, and repeat that.
Remember to use these rest intervals wisely. Take a drink, breathe deep, shake things out.
All right, next up, I want you to aim for 2mins at 90 RPM, plus 30sec at 105 RPM, twice.
Let's start off at 90 RPM here, nice and comfortable for you.
In 30sec, we'll keep the power the same, but up the cadence to 105+ RPM.
FAST FEET! Spin those legs for 30sec.
Good work! Now bring the cadence back down to 90 RPM again and we'll repeat that 1 more time.
Noticing a higher heart rate at a faster cadence is normal, and due to increased metabolic demands.
30 more seconds here, then we'll spin the legs nice and quick to finish up!
GO GO GO! Spin those legs quick!
10sec to go, don't let your cadence drop!
Excellent work! That 2 down and just 1 more to go. Let's take 2mins nice and easy again here.
All right, for our final steady state interval, I want to aim for 95-105 RPM, let's get those legs moving!
Let's go! Get those legs spinning up again and aim for 95-105 RPM here.
Settle down now, whatever cadence you chose in that range, aim to keep it steady and consistent now.
If you're feeling good, try to lift the cadence closer to the 105 RPM range for the last 3mins.
Final minute! You're looking great here! Don't let your cadence drop off now!
Great! That's it for the steady state work, next up we have our intermittent sets.
Let's take a couple of minutes easy first though :-)
All right, next up, we have 2 interval sets of on/off intervals.
These consist of 30sec at FTP, plus 30sec at 73% FTP, 6 times.
We'll also be using a higher cadence for the work intervals of 100 RPM, with a resting cadence of 85 RPM.
Ready? We're starting at 100 RPM...
Let's go! Spin those feet up quick and bring that power up!
Nicely done. Now bring the effort down and rest for 30sec.
Back up again, GO GO GO!
And recover again at 85 RPM.
PUSH IT!
C'mon now! This is halfway, UP UP UP!
Just 2 more to go, FAST FEET!
This is it! Make this one just as good as the first!
Hang on for the last 30sec, we're not done yet :-)
Great work with the first set! Let's take 4mins easy here.
Make sure you're sipping your fluids during these recoveries.
Okay, next up, we're repeating those 30/30s, but this time I want you to stand up during the work portion at 70 RPM.
Ready? We're starting these standing at 70 RPM.
Click down a few gears to slow your leg speed, and stand up!
Great! Now back to an easier gear and spin those legs up to 90+ RPM.
Stand up again here! Keep these transitions smooth.
And back to sitting again, great work so far!
UP! If this feels awkward standing, you need to practice it more :-)
Halfway done, back to standing here!
2 more reps to go, keep it up!
This is the last time standing, c'mon now!
Sit back down again and spin those legs up for the last 30sec, go go!
Excellent! That's 2 of those down, and 1 to go. Let's rest up again here.
1min to go here, then we're moving onto the last interval set of today :-)
This last interval is going to be a repeat of the first with the work intervals at 100 RPM, and the rest at 85 RPM.
Start spinning those legs up, we're starting at 100 RPM.
Let's go! Spin those feet up quick and bring that power up!
Nicely done. Now bring the effort down and rest for 30sec.
Back up again, GO GO GO!
And recover again at 85 RPM.
PUSH IT!
C'mon now! This is halfway, UP UP UP!
Just 2 more to go, FAST FEET!
This is it! Make this one just as good as the first!
Hang on for the last 30sec, we're not done yet :-)
Way to get it done today, my friend! That's a solid workout in under an hour.
We'll spend a few more minutes cooling down, then do your best recovering and refueling for the next workout!
See you next time :-)
